column1: # Any line in this file that starts with a # character is a comment.
# The rule set is defined with each component of the rule residing in a different cell.
# The file can then be saved out to CSV format (comma separated variables) and imported into the Order Checker.
# List of information NOT available via XML turn input:
# Commodities available in a population center.
# Checks NOT performed since Automagic/MEOW does them - but these are gone and Joverseer needs to pick up that job
# Comm/Em/Agent/Mage skill requirement for an order.
# The first column is always the order that the rule applies to.
# The second column is always the rule being enforced.
# The third and all other columns are the parameters that belong to the rule.
# Note: param # refers to the parameter number in the actual order file and is 1 based
# Rule Descriptions (an order can have more than one rule applied to it)

column3: Force = 1 if forced march, otherwise 0.  Checks the army movement and how many points it requires.   Also reports theoretical final destination and total movement points.  Assumes direction list starts at order parameter #2.  Parameter #1 is the type (evasive or normal).
Type 0 = army CO, 1 = with army.  Checks that the character is with an army or that an owned PC is at the character's location.
Char = param # of army CO.  Distance = max distance to army.  Checks that the army to be scouted isn't too far away.
Artifact = param #.  Checks to see if the character has the specified artifact.
Artifact  = 0 or param #.  Does some checking on the artifact search.
Type 1 = pass to parm #, 2 = drop, 3 = find. Artifacts = param # (up to 6).  Used for manipulating multiple artifacts on a character.
Artifact = param #.  Just reports the name of the artifact.

Char = 0 or param # for character name, Location = 0 or param #.  Status  0 = owned, 1 = don't care, 2 = not owned, 3 = owned by friendly nation, 4 = not owned, adjacent hex, 5 = owned or dual friendly relations, 6 = owned or us friendly.  Checks to see if a character is at a location.

Location = param #. Distance = # hexes. Type 0 = normal check, 1 = distance only, 2 = join army, 3 = leave army, 4 = to capital, 5 = join army only (current hex).  Checks the maximum character movement for the specified target.

Char = 0 or param #.  Location = 0 or param #.  Status is 0 - 6.  Type = 0 for army CO, 1 for navy CO, 2 for army or navy CO, 3 commander with army/navy (including CO), 4 = company, 5 any, 6 = with army, 7 = army CO or navy CO on land.  Checks to see if the character is a commander or at least with an army/navy.

Char = 0 or param #.  Location = 0 or param #. Status is 0 - 6. Type = 2 for army/navy CO, 4 for company commander, 5 for either, 6 with army, not CO. Checks to make sure the character the order is for is not a commander.
Char = param #. Indicates character is transfering their army/navy or company to someone else.
Type = 0 for harbor, 1 for port,  2 = harbor/port/shore, 3 = no harbor or port.  Checks to see if a harbor or port is present at the hex.
Location = 0 or param #.  Logic = 1 for army present, 0 = not present. Checks to see if an enemy army or navy is present.

Location = 0 or param #.  Direction = 0 for any or param #. Type = 1 (ford), 2 (bridge), 3 (deep river), 9 (deep river then road), 10 deep river or adjacent water.  Logic = 0 for exist, 1 for not.  Checks to see if the specified feature is or is not present.
Type: 0 = any, 1 = less than citadel.  Checks to see if fortifications are present in the PC in the current hex.
Char = 0 or param #.  Type = 0 for not hostage/NPC, 1 for hostage.  Checks the specified character to see if they are a hostage or not.
Checks to see if the character can improve the population center. Em + Loyalty > 70/90/110/130 for village/town/MT/City
Checks to make sure the order takes place on land.  Location = 0 for current character's location, otherwise order param # for location (1 based).
Param = amount #.  Amount = max # / natural mage rank, Type 0 = mounts, 1 = food, 2 = Troops.  Checks that the maximum commodity is not exceeded.
Type = 0 for friendly/neutral, 1 for enemy/neutral, 2 for display name only. Param = param #.  Checks to see that the specified nation is valid.

Checks the navy movement and how many points it requires.  Also reports theoretical final destination and total movement points.  Assumes direction list starts at order parameter #2.  Parameter #1 is the type (evasive or normal).
Param = param # for rank(s).  Type = 0 command, 1 = agent, 2 = emissary, 3 = mage, 4 = combo.   Checks new character creation and reports extra info.
Simply indicates this order has no rule checking that can take place.
Checks the victory conditions for issuing the one ring order.

Location = 0 or param #.  Type = 0 if owned, 1 owned or not hidden, 2 not owned and not hidden, 3 enemy and not hidden, 4 none, 7 = owned, not hidden, not capital, 8 = capital, 9 = any PC, 10 = owned or not hidden and friendly relations.  Checks to see if a PC is at a location.
Location = 0 or param #.  Type = 1 = C, 2 = V, 3 = T, 4 = MT, 5 =CY, 8 = T/MT/CY, 9 = MT/CY, 10 = not C.  Checks the size of the city at the given location.
Location = 0 or param #.  State = 0 possibly destroyed, 1 = possibly captured, 2 = possibly influenced away.  Sets PC state information.
Type 0 = transport, 1 = sell, 2 = buy.  Location = 0 (not used) or param #.  Product = param #.  Amount = param #.  Units = 0 for #, 1 = %.  Gives additional product transfer information.

Char = 0 or param #.  Rank 0 = command, 1 = agent, 2 = emissary, 3 = mage.  Min = minimum rank required. Type 0 = normal, 1 = new PC.  Checks that the specified character has a rank greater than the minimum.
Char = 0 or param #.  Type  0 = army CO, 1 = company CO.  Status = 0 to lose it, 1 to gain it.  Indicates a change in command status.
Location = 0 or param #.  War = param # for warships.  Tran = param # for transports.  With = 0 in hex, 1 with army/navy.  Checks that the required ships are present.
Location = 0 or parm #.  Type 0 = normal, 1 = capital.  Checks to see if the PC at the location is not under siege.
Spell = param # .  Checks to make sure the character has the pre-requisite spell.
Spell = param #.  Checks to make sure the character has the spell and processes its parameters.
Spells = param # (up to 6).  Checks the character has the specified spells.
Char = param #.  Checks to make sure that the character is the same command status as the specified character.
Checks to see what the chance is of the army threatening the PC.  Information message only.
Command = 0 for CO, 1 for with army. Retire 0 = no, 1 = yes. Troops x 6 are param #.  Checks to make sure the character's army has the specified # of troops.
Amount = param #. Param = param # or use Type if 0.  Type = troop type.  Food = 0 or param #.  Checks to see if the PC at the character's location can support hiring the specified amount of troops.
Char = 0 or param # for army CO.  Type = param # for troop type.  Checks that the character's army has the specified troop type.

Command = 0 for CO, 1 for with army. Char is param #. Troops x 6 are param #.  Checks to make sure both starting and ending armies have at least 100 troops and that the starting army has all of the stated amount for each type.
